application_type_full: Approval of details reserved by a condition (discharge)
decision_conditions: The details submitted are insufficient to support the discharge of Condition 3 (Construction Logistics Plan) of Planning Permission 19/01464/FUL. The submitted CMSLP provides insufficient details with regard to how materials will be broughtinto and removed from the site, and what measures will be put into place to safeguard pedestriansand other road users. Mention is made of the use of traffic marshals but the applicant shouldprovide a site management plan showing how this will operate in practice.The applicant is reminded that no construction-related vehicles (including those belonging toprivate contractors) are permitted to park on any residential road in the vicinity of the site, otherthan in a pay-and display bay in accordance with any time restrictions. Wherever possible,contractors should travel by public transport, walking or cycling.The applicant is advised that it is their responsibility to ensure that all relevant highways permits(e.g. scaffolding, hoarding, oversailing, tower crane), skip licenses, temporary traffic managementorders and parking permits as may be required are put in place at the appropriate times.If the means of construction vehicle access entails vehicles crossing the public footway (includinguse of an existing vehicle crossover) the applicant must contact the Highways Crossover Officer todetermine whether a strengthened crossover is required.No materials must be stored on the public highway unless this has been expressly permitted byRBK Highways.[INFORMATIVE] The applicant is advised to also contact the Highways Inspections Team toarrange for a highway condition survey to be undertaken before commencing these works.RBK Highways may from time to time advise the applicant that changes should be made to therouting of construction traffic and the applicant must abide by any such requests, even wherethese represent a departure from what has been previously stated in the CMP/CLP.Pending the applicant providing greater detail on loading/unloading routes into and through thesite and pedestrian management arrangements, Highways would not support Condition 3 beingdischarged.
